intro: Calandrinia prolifera, commonly known as the spreading purslane, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is a low-growing annual herb that thrives in arid and semi-arid environments. The plant produces small, yellow flowers and has fleshy, succulent leaves that store water. It belongs to the family Portulacaceae and is known for its ability to withstand drought conditions. Calandrinia prolifera is often found in disturbed soils and can spread rapidly through vegetative reproduction.
